theCriticalPearl.title: The Golden Takeaway
theCriticalPearl.content: Never administer nitroglycerin to a patient with signs of an inferior MI without first verifying RV involvementâ€”it's a critical step to prevent catastrophic hypotension.
theCriticalPearl.memoryAid: Remember: 'INFERIOR MI â€“ VERIFY RV' to prevent the 'NITRO NO-NO' catastrophe.

whatYouMastered: Before: Uncertain about nitroglycerin use in inferior MI â†’ After: Confident in identifying contraindications

avoidTheseTraps: Automatically giving nitroglycerin to all chest pain patients can lead to severe hypotension in inferior MI with RV involvement.
